content: When creating feature work, create a feature branch from dev rather than working directly on main or dev, push to feature branch first, then create PR to merge back to dev
User prefers fast-forward merges with `git merge --ff-only` to keep linear history when branches don't have diverging commits
User removed compression feature entirely from codebase rather than deprecating it - prefers complete removal of unused optional features over maintaining deprecated code
User prefers manual memory creation via gobby-memory tools over automatic memory extraction. Automatic extraction was creating duplicate/junk entries, so it was completely removed from the codebase.
User prefers manual memory creation via gobby-memory tools over automatic memory extraction. Automatic extraction was creating duplicate/junk entries, so it was completely removed from the codebase.
Repository uses `uv` as package/task runner - execute tests with `uv run pytest` (with flags like `-x` for stop-on-first-failure, `-m "not slow"` to skip slow tests)
Removing transformers package (4.42.4) eliminated 14 known CVEs - single outdated dependencies can create significant security risk
Dependency staleness is a risk factor - LLMLingua hadn't been updated since April 2024, signaling inactive maintenance and making it a good candidate for removal

Complete removal strategy is preferred over disabling/deprecating features. Removing memory_extract entirely eliminated maintenance burden and prevented accidental re-enablement, rather than leaving deprecated code.

Multi-file coordination is required for feature removal: must update handler registration, workflow configuration files, test files, AND installation templates (both project-local and shared deployment paths) to keep them synchronized.

Multi-file coordination is required for feature removal: must update handler registration, workflow configuration files, test files, AND installation templates (both project-local and shared deployment paths) to keep them synchronized.

Complete removal strategy is preferred over disabling/deprecating features. Removing memory_extract entirely eliminated maintenance burden and prevented accidental re-enablement, rather than leaving deprecated code.
Project uses `uv` as the package manager and task runner. Run full test suite with `uv run pytest`
Gobby internal state files (.gobby/memories.jsonl, .gobby/tasks.jsonl, .gobby/tasks_meta.json) are tracked in version control and modified during sessions

The shared installation template (session-lifecycle.yaml) is a critical part of the deployment path that must be kept in sync with code changes. Missing updates there leaves inconsistencies between project-local and shared installations.

The shared installation template (session-lifecycle.yaml) is a critical part of the deployment path that must be kept in sync with code changes. Missing updates there leaves inconsistencies between project-local and shared installations.
Test suite supports pytest markers including a 'slow' marker. Can skip slow tests with `-m "not slow"` flag
Use `git log --oneline main..dev` and `git log --oneline dev..main` to quickly compare branch states and identify which branch is ahead
Merging _resolve_raw method with main resolve method resulted in cleaner API and fewer test edge cases - consider method consolidation during cleanup work
Optional features that require test coverage across multiple modules add maintenance burden - removing unused optional functionality can simplify codebase and reduce test complexity
Pre-commit hooks like pip-audit can complicate refactoring workflows - may need to skip verification during dependency removal, though hooks validate successful removal
When removing optional features, test failures can reveal integration points - run tests after each removal to discover what else needs cleanup

When removing features, use grep to identify all references, test classes, individual test functions, and configuration blocks before beginning removal. Test coverage for removed features can be substantial (~800 lines) and scattered across multiple test files.
After removing a feature that was the sole consumer of an import, clean up unused imports (e.g., json import only used by memory_extract).
After removing a feature that was the sole consumer of an import, clean up unused imports (e.g., json import only used by memory_extract).

When removing features, use grep to identify all references, test classes, individual test functions, and configuration blocks before beginning removal. Test coverage for removed features can be substantial (~800 lines) and scattered across multiple test files.
Common pytest flags: `-v` for verbose output, `-m "not slow"` to skip slow tests
